title: XXVII International Congress of Entomology ICE2024
description: more information <https://ice2024.org>

title: International Mycological Congress IMC12
description: The main aims of the International Mycological Congress are to:<br class="mb-4"> * Engage the youth<br class="mb-4"> * Facilitate face-to-face meetings<br class="mb-4"> * Organize hands-on workshops in mycology<br class="mb-4"> more information <https://imc12.org>

title: UN Ocean Decade Conference
description: The conference will be a key moment for governments, leaders, maritime sectors, philanthropy, universities, private sector, NGOs and more, to take stock of the achievements of the first three years of the Ocean Decade and define a collective vision for the coming years. Participants will benefit from concrete examples and best practices in ocean science to deliver “the science we need for the ocean we want”.<br class="mb-4">A key outcome of the 2024 UN Ocean Decade Conference will be the publication of a set of white papers related to the 10 Decade Challenges, that will identify future priorities for the Ocean Decade to generate the knowledge needed for science-based solutions related to global challenges, such as climate change, food security, biodiversity conservation, sustainable ocean economy, pollution and natural hazards.<br class="mb-4">Read more <https://oceandecade.org/news/barcelona-to-host-2024-un-ocean-decade-conference/>

title: BES 2023 - British Ecological Society Annual Meeting 2023
description: Join ecologists from around the world in December 2023 for Europe’s largest and most welcoming conference dedicated to ecology.<br class="mb-4">Each year our Annual Meeting attracts over 1200 delegates and provides opportunities to meet new colleagues, develop your career, learn new skills, and share your science with the global ecological community.<br class="mb-4">We will be offering an exciting programme of internationally renowned plenary speakers, diverse thematic sessions, engaging workshops, and a variety of networking events.<br class="mb-4">More information here <https://www.britishecologicalsociety.org/events/bes-annual-meeting-2023/welcome-to-bes2023/>

title: Asia-Pacific Conference on Mosquito and Vector Control (AMV) 2023
description: In collaboration with Department of Disease Control, Ministry of Public Health (MoPH), Thailand and the Thailand Pest Management Association (TPMA) as co-organizations, Prof. Theeraphap Chareonviriyaphap from Kasetsart University (KU), is planning to host the Asia Pacific Conference on Mosquito and Vector Control (AMV) held in Chiang Mai between 27 and 30 November 2023.<br class="mb-4">The aim of the conference is to strengthen the Asia-Pacific regional mosquito and vector control capacity and network and review new technologies and approaches to address the rapidly changing landscape for mosquito control in the region. We are expecting 1000-1500 participants from Asia Pacific and other regions to join the conference.<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://www.amv2023.com/>

title: International Data Week 2023: A Festival of Data
description: Organized by the International Science Council’s Committee on Data (CODATA) and World Data System (WDS), and the Research Data Alliance (RDA), International Data Week brings together a global community of data scientists and data stewards; researchers from all domains; data, interoperability and informatics experts from all fields; industry leaders, entrepreneurs and policymakers.<br class="mb-4">This inclusive and celebratory Festival of Data will include in-person and virtual components that highlight the opportunities for the positive transformation of our world in the light of the COVID-19 pandemic and other global challenges.<br class="mb-4">IDW 2023 will combine the RDA Plenary Meeting, the biannual meeting of this international member organization working to develop and support global infrastructure facilitating data sharing and reuse, and SciDataCon 2023, the scientific conference addressing the frontiers of data in research organized by CODATA and WDS.

title: GB30: 30th Meeting of the GBIF Governing Board
description: The 30th meeting of the GBIF Governing Board and associated events will take place in Canberra, Australia, on 15-20 October 2023.<br class="mb-4">15 October - Nodes Training - Day 1 <https://gb30.gbif.org/programme#sunday-15-october-2023> 16 October - Nodes Training - Day 2 + NSG meeting <https://gb30.gbif.org/programme#monday-16-october-2023> 17 October - GBIF committee meetings <https://gb30.gbif.org/programme#tuesday-17-october-2023> 18 October -Governing Board meeting Day 1 <https://gb30.gbif.org/programme#wednesday-18-october-2023> 19 October - Governing Board meeting Day 2 <https://gb30.gbif.org/programme#thursday-19-october-2022> 20 October - National Symposium: The Role of Biological Collections in Australia’s Science-Policy Interface <https://gb30.gbif.org/programme#friday-20-october-2023><br class="mb-4">The GB30 information and registration website can be found at gb30.gbif.org <https://gb30.gbif.org/>.<br class="mb-4">Any questions about the meeting can be sent to GB30@gbif.org <mailto:GB30@gbif.org>.<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://gb30.gbif.org/>

title: Global Conference on Biodiversity and Monitoring
description: The Global Conference on Biodiversity and Monitoring is organized by GEO BON and its partners between 10-13 October 2023 in Montreal, Canada.<br class="mb-4">One year after COP15 of the UN CBD and the landmark agreement of a Global Biodiversity Framework, the GEO BON global conference will focus on the grand challenge of ‘Monitoring Biodiversity for Action’. A central theme will be the development of best practices and new technologies for biodiversity observations and monitoring to support transformative policy and conservation action.<br class="mb-4">The conference will offer a venue for sharing and exchanging scientific and traditional knowledge related to biodiversity change, from genes to ecosystems; the associated contributions to people, across all sectors of society; and its conservation, sustainable use and shared benefits.<br class="mb-4">Visit website <https://geobon.org/geo-bon-global-conference-monitoring-biodiversity-for-action/>

title: TDWG 2023
description: The Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG) annual conference in 2023 will be a hybrid meeting, hosted in Hobart, Tasmania by theAtlas of Living Australia, ALA <https://ala.org.au/> and the National Research Collections Australia, NRCA <https://www.csiro.au/en/about/facilities-collections/collections>.<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://www.tdwg.org/conferences/2023/>

title: European Conference on Ecological Modelling
description: In a world where biodiversity and ecosystem services are at high risk, business as usual is no longer possible. Transformation of how societies deal with natural resources is much needed, but requires a better understanding of how ecological and social-ecological systems respond to change and human intervention. Ecological Modelling thus needs to aim at predicting the response to change and to address multiple scales in time, space and organization that are relevant for management.<br class="mb-4">The 9th European Conference on Ecological Modelling, ECEM 2023, welcomes contributions that directly or indirectly support transformation. This includes strategies and models that focus on improving one or more of the following aspects: representation of response mechanisms, multi-criteria model evaluation, model-data fusion, sensitivity and robustness analyses, upscaling and transferability to new regions, link to management scenarios, social-ecological systems, transparency and reproducibility, implementation and testing of theories and concepts, and multi-modelling synthesis. In general, any contribution advancing ecological modelling is welcome.<br class="mb-4">The ECEM 2023 continues a series of conferences launched by the European chapter of ISEM, the International Society for Ecological Modelling. ISEM promotes the international exchange of ideas, scientific results, and general knowledge in the areas of systems’ analysis and simulations in ecology and application of ecological modelling for natural resource management.<br class="mb-4">Visit website <https://ecem23.eu/>

title: IPBES 10 (Tenth session of the Plenary of the Intergovernmental Science-Policy Platform on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services)
description: IPBES 10 will be preceded by regional consultations and a Stakeholder Day on 27 August 2023. Further information on these events will follow in due course.<br class="mb-4">At IPBES 10, the Plenary will consider, among other items, the thematic assessment of invasive alien species, as well as requests, inputs and suggestions for additional elements of the rolling work programme of the Platform up to 2030. Regular elections for the membership of the Bureau, including the IPBES Chair, will also be held at that session.<br class="mb-4">More information here <https://ipbes.net/events/ipbes-10>

title: ESA 2023 - Ecological Society of America 2023
description: The Ecological Society of America advances the science and practice of ecology and supports ecologists throughout their careers. The field of ecology has much to offer in addressing pressing ecological problems at all scales. Ecologists working in the private sector (e.g., as consultants, for industry, or in NGOs) and public sector (for resource management agencies or regulatory bodies) are the professionals most responsible for transferring ecological science to effectively manage, conserve, and restore species and ecosystems.<br class="mb-4">The ESA annual meeting provides a tremendous opportunity to engage private- and public-sector ecologists with academic ecologists who generate the science; however, this opportunity has historically largely been missed due to a lack of programming that would attract non-academics.<br class="mb-4">This year’s theme seeks to help create an ESA for All Ecologists by providing programming and inviting sessions that better engage private- and public-sector ecologists by highlighting projects that are implementing ecological science, collaborating across sectors, educating future scientists and decision makers, and disseminating basic and applied ecology research to those who need it most.<br class="mb-4">More information here <https://www.esa.org/portland2023/>

title: International Congress for Conservation Biology
description: ICCB is the premier global meeting for conservation scientists and professionals, including researchers, students, agency personnel, environmental educators, practitioners, and other conservation stakeholders. Attendees gather for lively discussions and scientific presentations on the nexus between biodiversity conservation and genetics, ecology, biogeography, anthropology, history, psychology, economics, conservation marketing, religion, and more.<br class="mb-4">It is an excellent opportunity for GBIF to engage with data issues relevant to the conservation biology community, and the location of this year's Congress in Africa enables us to have a special focus on GBIF's work on supporting mobilization and use of biodiversity data for African conservation.<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://conbio.org/mini-sites/iccb-2023/>

title: SMBE2023 Society for Molecular Biology and Evolution
description: Call for Symposia Proposals - Deadline 31, October, 2022

title: Symposium for European Freshwater Sciences (SEFS 13)
description: The Freshwater Biological Association FBA will be hosting SEFS13 in Newcastle Upon Tyne, England.

title: 2023 Virtual Data Mobilization Workshop for Asia
description: One of the challenges to open access biodiversity data in Asia is the lack of technical skills among data holders to mobilize it and make it available. The GBIF Biodiversity Data Mobilization workshop trains data holders in project management, data capture, data management and data publication, with a focus on GBIF's tools and infrastructure.<br class="mb-4">Participants who successfully complete the workshop receive a badge to certify the skills and expertise they acquire.<br class="mb-4">The GBIF Asia Support Team is planning to hold a virtual workshop during the week of 7 August 2023 to address capacity needs and to promote data publication in the region. This course will be based on the GBIF Biodiversity Data Mobilization curriculum and will be in English language.<br class="mb-4">Access the GBIF Biodiversity Data Mobilization curriculum <https://docs.gbif.org/course-data-mobilization/en/><br class="mb-4">This workshop has three phases of activities:<br class="mb-4">- 31st July - 4th August preparatory course activities (online self-paced) - 7th - 11th August virtual workshop (Zoom sessions and online self-paced, 4 hours per day)- 14th August - 3rd September certification exercises (online self-paced)<br class="mb-4">While we are keen to satisfy the high interest to this workshop, due to limited training personnel, we will only be able to accommodate 30 participants in this workshop. We hope all participants will become trainers or mentors for future workshops.<br class="mb-4">If we receive over 30 applications to participate in the training, we will select participants based on the following criteria (not in specific order):<br class="mb-4"> * Applicants that have already identified dataset(s) that they intend to publish and have cleared licensing requirements;  * Applicants that represent data holding institutions planning to publish data;  * Applicants that have plans to hold replication workshops;  * Applicants that intend to become mentors to support future workshops (advanced badge needed); The selection process will also consider geographic and thematic balance in the workshop participants.<br class="mb-4">The application will close at 23:59 UTC on the 7th of July 2023.<br class="mb-4">The result will be announced by the end of the 14th July 2023.<br class="mb-4"> Apply here <https://forms.gle/6VtQeu9tTtwW6DUNA>

title: Hosted Portals Community Call
description: A community call with network members who are running GBIF's hosted portal service <> will provide an opportunity for introducing some new teams, sharing updates on progress, and discussing potential new features.<br class="mb-4">Agenda<br class="mb-4">| Time | Topic | Speaker | | ----------- | --------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------| | 14:00–14:05 |Welcome and introduction | Mélianie Raymond <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6158-8202>GBIF Secretariat | | 14:05–14:25 | UpdatesMetrics / GRSciColl <> / Phylogenetic browser <https://www.legumedata.org/phylogeny/explore/> | Morten Høfft <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-4953-5220>GBIF Secretariat | | 14:25–15:25 | Community updates- Progress, plans and feedback on any blocking issues- Tips on promoting live portals <>, feedback reports- Feature requests and suggestions | Moderated discussion | | 15:25–15:30 | Next steps | Tim Robertson <https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6215-3617>GBIF Secretariat |<br class="mb-4">Anyone not currently involved in a hosted portal who wants to learn more can emailhostedportals@gbif.org <mailto:hostedportals@gbif.org> to request a Zoom link to join the call.

title: Simposio internacional sobre colecciones biologicas y datos abiertos de biodiversidad (in Spanish only)
description: El objetivo de este evento es dar a conocer el estado del arte de la gestión y uso de las colecciones biológicas y la implementación de sistemas de datos abiertos de biodiversidad en Latinoamérica mediante el intercambio de experiencias internacionales (Argentina, Brasil, Colombia, Ecuador, México y Chile).<br class="mb-4">El simposio se enmarca en el contexto de un Comité de Diversidad Biológica (CDB) que reside en la Vicerrectoría de Investigación y Desarrollo de la Universidad de Chile, cuyo objetivo es relevar e institucionalizar el rol de las colecciones biológicas y los datos abiertos en docencia, investigación y extensión.<br class="mb-4">Este evento es financiado por el Proyecto UCH-21991 “Fortaleciendo las bases del modelo académico de la Universidad de Chile: formación integral, calidad de vida estudiantil, vínculo laboral y el nexo de la investigación y formación” del Ministerio de Educación y del Proyecto InES de Ciencia Abierta INCA210002 de la Agencia Nacional de Investigación y Desarrollo de Chile. Además, está patrocinado por el Ministerio de Medio Ambiente (MMA) y por el Consorcio de Universidades del Estado de ChileCUECH <https://uchile.cl/agenda/206801/simposio-de-colecciones-biologicas-y-datos-abiertos-de-biodiversidad>.<br class="mb-4"> Inscripción  <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSetIa00NuRtGf-yxAOlG2kZhrHBq7p4HcgljzD0L9upVmIIhg/viewform><br class="mb-4">

title: ESA2024 - Ecological Society of America 2024
description: This year’s meeting will emphasize the society’s mission of supporting ecologists throughout their careers. The emphasis recognizes the need for us to continually invest in all the people who advance the science and practice of ecology. Among many aspects of professional development, we are planning programming and invite contributions that consider the transformational potential of effective mentorship.<br class="mb-4"> more information  <https://www.esa.org/longbeach2024/>

title: Technical support hour for GBIF nodes: September 2023
description: The GBIF technical support hour for Nodes is back!<br class="mb-4">For this session, we have a guest, Daniel Noesgaard <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0407-1805> from the Communication team, who will explain how GBIF tracks literature citations of GBIF data. How the citations are found, labelled, and integrated in the GBIF index. The Data Product team will also be there to answer any helpdesk question related or not to the topic of the presentation.<br class="mb-4">We will begin every session with a five minute practical topic, and then open the floor for technical questions including, but not limited to, the presented topic.<br class="mb-4">The drop-in office hour will be every first Wednesday of the month at 4pm CET (UTC+1)<br class="mb-4"> Register for the event <https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZcvcOGvrT4oE9wL-mhfROh9sJ-kFzhc_hn9> <br class="mb-4">If nodes and nodes staff have ideas for topics, or questions please post them in the community forum <https://discourse.gbif.org/t/gbif-technical-support-hour-for-nodes-tour-of-the-registry-and-how-to-debug-ingestion/3760> or email them tohelpdesk@gbif.org <mailto:helpdesk@gbif.org>

title: 2023 Global Nodes Events Launch
description: During this Zoom event, you will have an opportunity to preview the agendas for the Global Nodes Training and Global Nodes Meeting to be held inCanberra Australia 15-17 October <https://gb30.gbif.org/programme>.<br class="mb-4">Even if you are unable to attend the events in Canberra, we encourage you to attend thisvirtual event <https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZcpduqoqjgpHtB4LmamwidZJcjj_H539J_t> to learn how you can stay in the loop and receive benefit from the training and meeting after they are concluded. This virtual event will be recorded.<br class="mb-4">Questions can be sent to nodes@gbif.org <mailto:nodes@gbif.org><br class="mb-4">Agenda<br class="mb-4"> * Welcome address  * Introduction to the nodes buddy system  * Introduction to the Global Nodes Training  * Recap on process, format, goals  * Launch of preparation activities  * Introduction to the Global Nodes Meeting  * Recap on process, format, goals  * Launch of preparation activities  * Staying engaged and opportunities to contribute  * In person and remotely Registration <https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZcpduqoqjgpHtB4LmamwidZJcjj_H539J_t> is restricted to GBIF Participant Node Managers and staff<br class="mb-4">Register for the event <https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZcpduqoqjgpHtB4LmamwidZJcjj_H539J_t>

title: IBC 2024 XX International Botanical Congress
description: <br class="mb-4">The IBC 2024 XX International Botanical Congress in Madrid will address the following main topics:<br class="mb-4"> * Systematics, phylogenetics, biogeography and evolution  * Ecology, environment and global change, including invasive species and plant-animal interactions  * Biodiversity and conservation  * Structure, physiology and development, including Evo-Devo  * Genetics, genomics and bioinformatics  * Plants and Society  Register for the event <https://ibcmadrid2024.com/index.php?seccion=registrationArea&subSeccion=registrationInfo>

title: ISME19
description: Organized every two years, the ISME symposia are the largest not-for-profit international meetings addressing the wide range of topics in Microbial Ecology. With an average delegate number of 2200 people representing over 50 countries worldwide we are truly international.<br class="mb-4">The next meeting, ISME19, will be held in Cape Town, South Africa, 2024.<br class="mb-4">read more <https://www.isme-microbes.org/symposia-events>

title: Biodiversity Information for Development showcase
description: Enhancing capacity to mobilize and use biodiversity data effectively to support the Global Biodiversity Framework<br class="mb-4">This GBIF- and EU-hosted symposium brings together key stakeholders, including representatives from funded projects, funders, aligned initiatives, and policymakers to reflect on the progress to date of theBiodiversity Information for Development <> (BID) programme. The event will also serve as a forum for discussing future directions for the programme to support effective implementation of theKunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework <https://www.cbd.int/article/cop15-final-text-kunming-montreal-gbf-221222> (GBF).<br class="mb-4">The showcase will be organized across three sessions with a series of speakers sharing perspectives on a single theme in each. The symposium will conclude with all speakers convening for a facilitated discussion.<br class="mb-4">Representatives from the GBIF network, BID projects, and regional support teams will participate in a closed workshop on the following day.<br class="mb-4">The event will be livestreamed to reach a wider audience and generate input from other potential stakeholders and spark further discussions about the programme.<br class="mb-4"> Register for live stream <https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_CWFtezGsROa0sWZPrJ5XVw><br class="mb-4">Objectives<br class="mb-4"> * Showcase strength and impact of BID programme to date and explore its future needs and priorities  * Discuss the relevance of aligned regional and global initiatives for supporting the global activities and objectives of title: New data model: Exploring interactions data on plant pollination
description: Our next community webinar will explore another example of how the new data model <> expands the possibilities for evolving and enriching the Darwin Core standard, this time taken from theWorldFAIR <https://worldfair-project.eu/> project led byCODATA <https://codata.org> and the Research Data Alliance <https://www.rd-alliance.org>.<br class="mb-4">GBIF and Embrapa <https://www.embrapa.br/> are leading adjacent work packages on biodiversity and agricultural biodiversity for this EU-funded project. Following an overview of their work packages, team members will discuss the results of Embrapa's effort to map interactions data on plant pollinators to Darwin Core'sExtended Measurement or Facts <https://rs.gbif.org/extension/obis/extended_measurement_or_fact_2023-08-28.xml> extension and its implications for the new data model.<br class="mb-4">Register for the event <https://zoom.us/meeting/register/tJIqd--spz8tG9UHWVh0ki_BC2RIxI33HPWc#/registration><br class="mb-4">Agenda<br class="mb-4">| Time | Topic | Speaker | | ----- | ------------------------------------------ | ------------------- | | 15:00-15:05 | Welcome and introduction |Alex Delipalta <https://www.rd-alliance.org/users/alex-delipalta>RDA Europe <https://www.rd-alliance.org/rda-europe> | | 15:05-15:20 | WorldFAIR WP9: Overview of the GBIF Unified Data Model | Joe Miller <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-5788-9010> & John Wieczorek <https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1144-0290>GBIF| | 15:20-15:35 | WorldFAIR WP10: Use cases for agriculture-related pollinator data standards |Debora Drucker <https://orcid.org/0000-0003-4177-1322>Embrapa | | 15:35-15:55 | Panel and Q&AConnecting the work packages: GBIF Unified Model and interactions data on plant pollination | Alex DelipaltaDebora DruckerJoe MillerTim Robertson <https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6215-3617>José Augusto Salim <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-8675-7068>Maarten Treckels <https://orcid.org/0000-0003-4177-1322>John Wieczorek |<br class="mb-4">Resources<br class="mb-4"> * Diversifying the GBIF Data Model <>  * Use Case: Biotic Interactions - Sottunga Island Melitaea cinxia Population Study <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jzb54GbAkB_TOFIjWof5BW6gn1ujSnXXJQu6aZgFAB4/edit#heading=h.s91o7eupvwg7> * Data standard for sharing ecological and environmental monitoring data documented for community review <https://worldfair-project.eu/2023/06/01/data-standard-for-sharing-ecological-and-environmental-monitoring-data-documented-for-community-review-deliverable-9-1/> (WorldFAIR Deliverable 9.1)  * Agriculture-related pollinator data standards use cases report <https://worldfair-project.eu/2023/07/31/agriculture-related-pollinator-data-standards-use-cases-report-deliverable-10-1/> (WorldFAIR Deliverable 10.1)  * Salim JA et al., Data standardization of plant-pollinator interactions, GigaScience, Volume 11, 2022a, giac043 <https://doi.org/10.1093/gigascience/giac043>  <hhttps://worldfair-project.eu/>

title: Mastering Data Citation: Insights from GBIF
description: Why is data citation crucial for biodiversity data?<br class="mb-4">Data citation is a fundamental step in promoting transparency, credibility, and collaboration in the field of biodiversity research. It ensures that the hard work of data collectors and curators is recognized and facilitates the sharing and integration of valuable biodiversity datasets.<br class="mb-4">This webinar will shed light on the crucial aspects of recognizing and attributing biodiversity research datasets, as well as to provide best practices for standardized dataset citation that acknowledge creators and sources, ultimately making data more discoverable, reusable, and crediting those who collect and manage it.<br class="mb-4">Join us on 6 November 2023, as GBIF guides you through the essential techniques for citing biodiversity data effectively.<br class="mb-4">Agenda<br class="mb-4">15:00 - 15:10 General introduction of the BioDT project – Hanna Koivula (CSC) 15:10 - 15:35 Data citation: the GBIF way – Daniel Noesgaard (GBIF) 15:35 - 16:00 Q & A<br class="mb-4"> Register for webinar <https://biodt.eu/events/mastering-data-citation-insights-gbif> <br class="mb-4">This webinar is organized by BioDT <https://biodt.eu/events/mastering-data-citation-insights-gbif> and is part of a series of webinars focused on sharing best practices on data citation.

title: Technical support hour for GBIF nodes: October 2023
description: In the October issue of the support hour, the Data Products team will explain what the current routine is to improve the stability of occurrence urls (IDs).See this news item for some background. <https://www.gbif.org/news/2M3n65fHOhvq4ek5oVOskc/new-processing-routine-improves-stability-of-gbif-occurrence-ids> We will go over what our system checks and what can be done when changes are detected.<br class="mb-4">We will also answer any helpdesk question related or not to the topic of the presentation.<br class="mb-4"> Register for the event <https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZEpdeuvrT0tHd3Lqo6aBSCaU6aAc0hqDbDZ> <br class="mb-4">If nodes and nodes staff have ideas for topics, or questions please post them in the community forum <https://discourse.gbif.org/t/gbif-technical-support-hour-for-nodes-tour-of-the-registry-and-how-to-debug-ingestion/3760> or email them tohelpdesk@gbif.org <mailto:helpdesk@gbif.org>

title: Evolution 2024 | Third Joint Congress on Evolutionary Biology
description: <br class="mb-4">The Congress merges the traditions of the participating societies: the European Society for Evolutionary Biology (ESEB); the American Society of Naturalists (ASN); the Society of Systematic Biologists (SSB); and the Society for the Study of Evolution (SSE). The sextennial Congress takes the place of the ESEB and Evolution Meetings in 2024, and it builds on the success of the previous Congresses in Ottawa in 2012 and Montpellier in 2018.<br class="mb-4">The structure of this Congress will be unique. Roughly 40% of talks will be structured into symposia, following the traditional ESEB format. The remaining 60% of talks will be structured into general sessions according to topic, following the traditional Evolution meetings format. The success of the joint meeting therefore depends on the strength and range of the symposia complementing the standard sessions.<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://www.evolutionsociety.org/news/display/2023/8/9/now-accepting-symposium-proposals-for-evolution-2024/>

title: Technical support hour for GBIF nodes: November 2023
description: In this November session, we will explain how we identify related occurrence records on GBIF (which is sometimes referred to as the GBIF "data clustering" feature). For some background information, you can read our blogposthere <https://data-blog.gbif.org/post/clustering-occurrences/>. Tim Robertson <https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6215-3617> from the Informatics team will join the session. We will be happy to answer any question relating or not to the topic.<br class="mb-4"> Register for the event <https://ucph-ku.zoom.us/meeting/register/u5Eqce6vqj4iGNbFYoF7nPdd7dD3rh_n7_-X#/registration><br class="mb-4">If nodes and nodes staff have ideas for topics, or questions please post them in the community forum <https://discourse.gbif.org/t/gbif-technical-support-hour-for-nodes-tour-of-the-registry-and-how-to-debug-ingestion/3760> or email them tohelpdesk@gbif.org <mailto:helpdesk@gbif.org>

title: SBDI Days 2024: Towards Data-driven Ecology
description: <br class="mb-4">SBDI Days: Towards data-driven ecology is hosted by the Swedish Biodiversity Data Infrastructure and will take place on January 24th-25th 2024 at the Swedish Museum of Natural History in Stockholm.<br class="mb-4">The event will offer keynotes and presentations, posters, demonstrations, and time to mingle and exchange ideas about data driven ecology.<br class="mb-4">Registration deadline 2024-01-10<br class="mb-4"> Register  <https://www.nrm.se/sbdidays>

title: AGU 2023: Annual meeting of the American Geophysical Union
description: Join GBIF Secretariat communications manager Kyle Copas <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6590-599X> at the following sessions during the AGU Fall Meeting 2023 <https://www.agu.org/fall-meeting>—or seek him out <mailto:kcopas@gbif.org> elsewhere during the meeting.<br class="mb-4">Monday, 12 December 2023: 17:05-17:15 How Biodiversity Data Supports Research on Climate-driven Changes in Patterns of Human Diseases <https://agu.confex.com/agu/fm23/meetingapp.cgi/Paper/1337657> Session: GH14A: Advances in Climate-Driven Models for Vector-Borne DiseasesMoscone West-2020, L2<br class="mb-4">Wednesday, 13 December 2023: 09:15-09:24 "Darwin More": Diversifying the GBIF Data Model to Improve the Richness and Quality of FAIR and Open Data about Biological Material Samples <https://agu.confex.com/agu/fm23/meetingapp.cgi/Paper/1264054> Session: IN31A: Preserving Our Primary Field Data for Future Generations of Geoscientific Research: Perspectives on Managing Physical Samples, Airborne Observations, and Other Field DataMoscone West-2014, L2<br class="mb-4">NOTE: all event times are Pacific Standard Time (UTC-8).<br class="mb-4">Read more <https://www.agu.org/fall-meeting>

title: Global Registry of Scientific Collections (GRSciColl) community call
description: Join us for an update on the Global Registry of Scientific Collections. In this community call we will focus on the first item of the GRSciColl road map: the review of the data schema.<br class="mb-4">Agenda:<br class="mb-4"> * Welcome and introduction  * Data Schema and Road Map Update  * Q&A and Discussion We encourage all participants to actively engage in the review process. Your input is invaluable. If you're eager to participate, you can start by reviewing thedata schema documentation <https://www.gbif.org/news/6QmgDWnOORMkZIG9xvZAD> beforehand and ask questions or share your insights on our dedicatedforum thread <https://discourse.gbif.org/c/grscicoll>.<br class="mb-4"> Register  <https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZckf-GrqTIjGNGb_JzjFkp_H6RLSAImEagc>

title: EC-ESA JOINT EARTH SYSTEM SCIENCE INITIATIVE
description: This event focuses on: Reviewing the latest advances in EO and Earth System Science across domains and specially to showcase the latest ESA and EC funded results, projects (e.g., ESA Science Clusters), and initiatives as a basis for networking and interdisciplinary science.<br class="mb-4"> Read more  <https://essi2023.esa.int/>

title: Technical support hour for GBIF nodes: December 2023
description: In the December session, we will explain the new features of Integrated Publishing Toolkit Version 3.0 (IPT3).<br class="mb-4">For some background information, you can read our release information here <https://ipt.gbif-uat.org/manual/en/ipt/latest/releases#3-0-rc1-august-2023>.<br class="mb-4">Mikhail Podolskiy <https://dk.linkedin.com/in/mikhail-podolskiy-a34658154> from the Informatics team will join the session. We will be happy to answer any question relating or not to the topic.<br class="mb-4"> Register for the event <https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZMocOuorT4pE9IQGeccjRPj8dY52HcXdv-o> <br class="mb-4">If nodes and nodes staff have ideas for topics, or questions please post them in the community forum <https://discourse.gbif.org/t/gbif-technical-support-hour-for-nodes-tour-of-the-registry-and-how-to-debug-ingestion/3760> or email them tohelpdesk@gbif.org <mailto:helpdesk@gbif.org>

title: NBN Conference
description: Join GBIF Secretariat communications manager Kyle Copas <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6590-599X> at the following meeting “Transmitting the value of GBIF at national scale” at the NBN Conference at the National Museums Scotland in Edinburgh.<br class="mb-4">The theme of the conference will follow the NBN Trust Strategy 2022-2027 “Making data work for nature” with each of the sessions following our four Strategic Ambitions:<br class="mb-4">Ambition 1: The NBN Atlas is the ‘go to’ place for sharing, finding and accessing UK biodiversity data<br class="mb-4">Ambition 2: Biodiversity data is providing the evidence needed for nature’s recovery<br class="mb-4">Ambition 3: Citizen science is valued, supported and expanded as a major source of biodiversity data<br class="mb-4">Ambition 4: The National Biodiversity Network is a well-connected and highly collaborative community with a united voice on key issues<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://nbn.org.uk/news-events-publications/nbn-conference-2/nbn-conference-2023/kyle-copas-nbn-conference-2023/>

title: International Conference on Mycorrhizas (ICOM 12)
description: The theme of ICOM12 is “Bridging gaps in form, function and diversity”.<br class="mb-4">Alongside showcasing some of the most exciting and cutting-edge mycorrhizal research, the conference will address this theme through conversation, culture, gastronomy, and fun.<br class="mb-4">The plenary themes are supported by parallel sessions that will cover topics such as: Mycorrhizas in ecosystem structure and function; Evolution of a mycorrhizal world: drivers and under-explored mycorrhizal systems; Genes to molecules: mechanisms of resource exchange; Mycorrhizas, climate and environmental change; Strengthening links between genomics and ecology.<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://icom12.org/>

title: ECSA 2024 conference: Change
description: <br class="mb-4">Be part of one of the leading citizen science events in Europe, to discuss and network with citizen science practitioners, researchers, activists, scientists, policymakers, artists, and more.<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://2024.ecsa.ngo/>

title: Hacking Biodiversity Data Cubes for Policy
description: B-Cubed’s hackathon is planned as a 4-day event, bringing together biodiversity informaticians, researchers, and practitioners who are passionate about leveraging biodiversity data for impactful solutions.<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://b-cubed.eu/b-cubed-hackathon>

title: BioDT Hackathon: Bring Your Own Data (BYOD) - Second End-Users Workshop
description: A transformative three-day hackathon titled Harnessing Digital Twinning for Sustainable Agriculture: Predictive Characterisation and Conservation of Crop Wild Relatives, takes place from January 23rd to 25th, 2024 in Oslo, Norway.<br class="mb-4">The event, promises to unravel the immense potential of digital twinning in revolutionizing global agricultural practices.<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://biodt.eu/form/biodt-bring-your-own-data-in-osl>

title: Data Use Club seminar: 2023 Graduate Researchers Award winners
description: The 2023 GBIF Graduate Researchers Award winners will present their work to theGBIF Data Use Club <> community.<br class="mb-4">Dorothy Akoth <https://www.gbif.org/news/6qTuv5Xf1qa05arROvx7Y1/>, master's student atMakarere University <https://cns.mak.ac.ug/> in Uganda, will present her research in improving the knowledge of the distribution and imperilment status of 110 native fish species outside the iconic Haplochromine tribe of East African cichlids.<br class="mb-4">Andre Vicente Liz <https://www.gbif.org/news/9SpIV0pXkqfAAhJ6s0IvJ/portuguese-student-andre-vicente-liz-wins-2023-gbif-graduate-researchers-award>, a PhD candidate at theResearch Centre in Biodiversity and Genetic Resources <https://cibio.up.pt/en/>(CIBIO-InBIO) at the University of Porto, will present his integrated analysis of the genetic and spatial distribution patterns of 107 vertebrate species that live in the Sahara-Sahel desert.<br class="mb-4">The event is open for all, and attendees will have an opportunity to ask questions and exchange ideas following the presentation.<br class="mb-4">Email advance comments and questions to datause@gbif.org <mailto:datause@gbif.org>.<br class="mb-4">Register now <https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZMocuuhrDoqGt3ZI1QGU9uEP_48Fb6YNq1Z>

title: Technical support hour for GBIF nodes: January 2024
description: This January, we celebrate one year of Technical Support Hour for Nodes <https://www.gbif.org/composition/lKyZFAUnIDv8kpf0CgZsS/technical-support-hour-for-gbif-nodes>!<br class="mb-4">In the first session of 2024, Paloma Shimabukuro <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-5114-953X> will give you an overview of what is currently available for publishing health data on GBIF. Paloma is the GBIF contractor behind theGBIF health Helpdesk <> and is working on mobilizing vector-borne disease data.<br class="mb-4">The Data Products team will join as well. We will be happy to answer any question relating or not to the topic.<br class="mb-4"> Register for the event <https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZ0rcOypqTguHdA4X1KI5f_o4uoEkMeLiGbA> <br class="mb-4">If nodes and nodes staff have ideas for topics, or questions please post them in the community forum <https://discourse.gbif.org/t/gbif-technical-support-hour-for-nodes-tour-of-the-registry-and-how-to-debug-ingestion/3760> or email them tohelpdesk@gbif.org <mailto:helpdesk@gbif.org>

title: SPNHC and TDWG Joint Conference
description: The Society for the Preservation of Natural History Collections SPNHC <https://spnhc.org/> is an international organization devoted to the preservation, conservation and management of natural history collections.<br class="mb-4">Biodiversity Information Standards TDWG <https://www.tdwg.org/> develops and maintains data standards that support the integration of primary biodiversity information across disciplines, organizations, and nations. Its annual conference has become a preeminent forum for advancing biodiversity informatics.<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://www.tdwg.org/conferences/2024/>

title: 9th International Barcode of Life Conference
description: GBIF and the new data model serve for barcoding/metabarcoding data storage and use<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://dnabarcodingconference.com/>

title: Technical support hour for GBIF nodes: February 2024
description: The theme for February session of the Technical Support Hour for Node, is DNA <https://www.gbif.org/dna> data publishing. For this session, we welcome Tobias Guldberg Frøslev <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-3530-013X> from the Participation and Engagment team. Tobias will present the resource currently available for sharing DNA-derived data - with a focus on a new tool for formatting environmental DNA dataset – on GBIF and answer all your questions on the topic.<br class="mb-4">You are welcome to read more about DNA and GBIF here <https://discourse.gbif.org/t/invitation-to-share-dna-metabarcoding-data-to-test-early-pilot-of-data-publishing-tool/3975><br class="mb-4">The Data Product team will join as well. We will be happy to answer any question relating or not to the topic.<br class="mb-4"> Register for the event <https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZAlcumhpjopHNJ4yzlZLVVBsEb0NR7RkSIy> <br class="mb-4">If nodes and nodes staff have ideas for topics, or questions please post them in the community forum <https://discourse.gbif.org/t/gbif-technical-support-hour-for-nodes-tour-of-the-registry-and-how-to-debug-ingestion/3760> or email them tohelpdesk@gbif.org <mailto:helpdesk@gbif.org>

title: ARISE day 2024
description: The ARISE project <https://www.arise-biodiversity.nl/> is building an infrastructure that will identify and monitor all multicellular species in the Netherlands.<br class="mb-4">On March 27 the ARISE day will provide updates on ARISE, keynote speeches, workshops, entertainment, meet old friends, make new ones. All lectures and activities will be in English.<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://www.arise-biodiversity.nl/arise-day-2024>

title: Empowering Biodiversity Research III (EBR III)
description: This conference will focus on utilizing biodiversity data to bridge the gap with Policy.<br class="mb-4">Meet GBIF Secretariat deputy director Tim Hirsch <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-5015-5807> at the following session during the EBR III conference <https://www.biodiversity.be/EBRIII/programme/><br class="mb-4">Monday, 25 March 2024: 10:40-11:10 GBIF’s role in empowering biodiversity research and policy <https://www.biodiversity.be/EBRIII/programme/> Session 1<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://www.biodiversity.be/EBRIII/>

title: Celebrating 10 Years of US MBON -2024 Annual All-Hands Workshop
description: MarineBon meeting to strengthen links between national MBON teams and partners and identify or develop common activities and outputs. Followed by a species distribution modelling workshop to trace a roadmap to move from research to operations in the ability to map distributions of species and habitats using ‘Species Distribution Models’ or SDMs as a complement to assessments now possible with databases such as OBIS and GBIF.

title: Joint OBIS-GBIF meeting
description: The two organisations will come to together to develop a joint GBIF-OBIS action plan to further support collaboration between the two infrastructures.<br class="mb-4">Participation by invitation only.<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://www.oceanexpert.org/event/4048>

title: CROMENT Workshop on biodiversity data and the GBIF network 2024
description: This workshop, organized in Croatia as part of the CESP project “CroMent” (CESP2023-006) <https://www.gbif.org/project/CESP2023-006/croment>, is a full week of GBIF immersion. Next to a GBIF community workshop, where it will be taught on how GBIF works, there will also be two full days on data cleaning and publication. These two days (February 21 and 22) are intended to be a hands-on workshop focused on mobilizing biological observation datasets to theGlobal Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF) <https://www.gbif.org/> by helping data providers standardize their data using Darwin Core including species observations from any type of sampling methodologies (e.g. visual surveys, microscopy, imaging, telemetry). The other three days are dedicated to setting up the GBIF node in Croatia in the framework of the GBIF CESP CroMent (Mentoring Croatia) project.<br class="mb-4">See event website <https://www.biodiversity.be/croment> for full workshop information, schedule and overview recordings of each lesson.<br class="mb-4">Audience The hands-on workshop is open for researchers, data curators, data managers who have an interest in the publication of data onGBIF <https://www.gbif.org/>. The GBIF community workshop is on invitation only. However the material available on theevent’s website <https://www.biodiversity.be/croment> could be of interest for anyone who is developing a GBIF Node and community.<br class="mb-4">Contact Please email d.brosens@biodiversity.be <> for more information.

title: Biodiversity Information for Development (BID) Knowledge Exchange Webinar
description: As the BID programme <https://www.gbif.org/programme/82243/bid-biodiversity-information-for-development> concludes, the GBIF Secretariat is dedicated to facilitating opportunities to share best practices identified by BID project teams and partner.<br class="mb-4">The knowledge exchange webinar will:<br class="mb-4"> * Provide a platform for BID project teams to showcase key achievements and impacts of their BID-funded projects.  * Facilitate the exchange of experiences, ideas, and connections among project teams in the region.  * Discuss key challenges and opportunities, sharing best practices.  * Support the visibility of the work performed under BID and reflect on alignment with multilateral agreements.  * Explore regional trends and priorities in capacity needs and biodiversity data mobilization and use During this event, we will present the main results of the BID programme and further discuss the impact of BID on Data mobilization; Data use and capacity building; and Sustainability and scaling up during a set of panel discussions.<br class="mb-4">The panel discussion in each session will invite two representatives from each region (Latin America and the Caribbean & Africa) to share their reflections on the topics. The audience will also be invited to share their experiences and any questions<br class="mb-4"> Register <https://us02web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZAsdOmorjwvGNzAhaBuQNLg2C6oHNkqtD5o> <br class="mb-4">Participants are kindly encouraged to view the pre-recorded presentation videos produced by selected BID projects before the meeting <https://vimeo.com/showcase/10661577?page=2&page=1><br class="mb-4">| Time (CEST) | Title | Speaker | | ------------ | -------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------- | | 3:00–3:05 | Welcome address| Tim Hirsch - GBIF Secretariat| | 3:05-3:25 |Data mobilization Introduction and regional perspectives & panel discussion. | Leonardo Buitrago <https://www.gbif.org/programme/82243/bid-biodiversity-information-for-development#contractors> (Regional support team) | 3:25-3:45 |Data use and capacity building Introduction and regional perspectives & panel discussion. | Tsiky Rabetrano <https://www.gbif.org/programme/82243/bid-biodiversity-information-for-development#contractors> (Regional support team) | 3:45-4:05 |Sustainability and scaling up Introduction & perspectives & panel discussion. | Laban Musinguzi <https://www.gbif.org/programme/82243/bid-biodiversity-information-for-development#contractors> (Regional support team) | 4:05–4:30 | closure | Tim Hirsch - GBIF Secretariat|

title: Transforming Australia's biological collections to open data
description: Join the Atlas of Living Australia (ALA) <https://www.ala.org.au/> for the first webinar of 2024 showcasing a selection of amazing projects from the Australian Biodiversity Data Mobilisation Program. This important initiative supports the mobilisation of Australia’s biodiversity data which may not yet be digital, making it available through the ALA, and internationally to the Global Biodiversity Information Facility. By improving digital access, the program delivers stronger research and conservation outcomes for Australia’s unique biodiversity.<br class="mb-4">In this free event, you'll hear from Queensland Museum & Gaia Resources, Tasmanian Museum and Art Gallery and Western Australian Museum whose projects have been supported through the program. Learn about the transformative power of biodiversity data, and how previously inaccessible physical specimens in biological collections can be made available as open data.<br class="mb-4">This event will be recorded and the recording made available through the ALA blog and social channels in the week after the event.<br class="mb-4">This free event is open to anybody with an interest in Australia’s biodiversity.<br class="mb-4">Registrtion <>

title: IPBES 11 (Eleventh session of the Plenary of the Intergovernmental Science-Policy Platform on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services)
description: IPBES 11 will be preceded by regional consultations and a Stakeholder Day on 9 December 2024. Further information on these events will follow in due course.<br class="mb-4">At IPBES 11, the Plenary will consider, among other items, the thematic assessment of the interlinkages among biodiversity, water, food and health (nexus assessment), the thematic assessment of the underlying causes of biodiversity loss and the determinants of transformative change and options for achieving the 2050 Vision for Biodiversity (transformative change assessment) as well as the scoping report for the second global assessment on biodiversity and ecosystem services.<br class="mb-4"> Read more <https://www.ipbes.net/notification/save_the_date_IPBES11>
